1655 Pamplona to SJPdP

ALSA provides seasonal bus service through its subsidiary Conda from Pamplona bus station to St Jean Pied de Port. The bus travels via Roncesvalles and Valcarlos. The bus returns to Pamplona after arriving in SJPdP.

The bus stops at the junction of Route d'Arneguy and Route d'Uhart.

At time of writing the bus from Pamplona to SJPdP runs daily 1730 17 March to 30 September 2014 and 1430 1 June to 30 Sept 2014. The schedule is typically updated a month in advance of changes. Use the ALSA international tab and click the 'query without date' button.

There are PESA buses twice daily (except Sunday) from Bilbao Termibus to Place de Basques Bayonne.

Chronoplus bus #5, 8, B, or N departs from Place de Basques to Gare de Bayonne.

1664 Bilbao to Hendaye Euskotren Option

Take Metro from San Mames to Etxebarri Station or take Euskotren Transvia tram to Atxuri Station.

Euskotren commuter trains travel from Atxuri Station and Etxebarri Station to Hendaia station, co-located with SNCF Gare d'Hendaye France, where Euskotren tracks terminate. A transfer is required at San Sebastian Euskotren Amara station.

Euskotren Colon station is the closest to Irun Renfe station and is probably the best way to get from Irun to Gare d'Hendaye.

1668 Bayonne to SJPdP

SNCF TER trains #62 travel from Gare de Bayonne to SJPdP where it terminates. Sometimes the train goes from Bayonne to Cambo les Bains and a bus carries onward passengers to SJPdP. Sometimes a bus is provided for the entire trip. Note tracks were washed out Spring 2014 and repaired November 2015.

Barcelona Airport (BCN)

http://www.aena-aeropuertos.es/csee/Satellite/Aeropuerto-Barcelona/en/Home.html

Connect from Barcelona Airport to Train and Bus Station - Sants - with Renfe Cercanias/Rodalies R2 from Terminal 2. The train runs every 30 minutes. Time to Barcelona Sants is 22 minutes.

Connect from Barcelona Airport to Bus Station -Nord - with Renfe Cercanias/Rodalies R2 from Terminal 2. Transfer at Sants to train R3 or R4 to Arc de Triomf stop then walk 300 meters along Av de Vilanova to the station.

Alternatively, connect from Barcelona Airport to Bus station -Nord- with Aeroport bus from either T1 or T2 to Placa Catalunya. Walk from Placa Catalunya via Arc de Triomf to the bus station, a twenty-minute walk (1400 meters) or take the Metro L1.

There is a shuttle connecting Terminal 1 to Terminal 2.

There are several bus companies providing service from Barcelona Airport. See the Airport website transport and access.

2352 Barcelona to SJPdP via Toulouse by Train

SNCF and Renfe operate trains from Barcelona (Sants) to Toulouse (Matabiau). Use SNCF site.

There is a high speed train to Paris that stops in Toulouse. Other trains transfer at break of gauge station Port Bou/Cerbère and require transfer at Perpignan or Narbonne before getting to Toulouse.

SNCF operates trains from Toulouse to Bayonne.

The final leg involves SNCF TER train #62 from Bayonne to SJPdP.

2353 Barcelona to SJPdP via Irun by Train

Renfe operates trains from Barcelona (Sants) to break of gauge stations at Irun/Hendaye.

Irun Renfe Station and Gare d'Hendaye are train stations 3 km apart.

Note that an end run might be possible by traveling from Barcelona to Miranda del Ebro (where trains from all over Spain converge) and then to Irun.

Euskotren operates a commuter train from Irun Colon Station to Hendaia Station if needed.

Euskotren Colon Station: exit Renfe Station, turn right, walk across bridge over the tracks and find Colon Station on the left (North) side of the street. Hendaia Station is co-located with Gare d'Hendaye.

SNCF operates TGV and Intercites trains from Irun and TER trains from Hendaye to Bayonne.

The final leg involves SNCF TER train #62 from Bayonne to SJPdP.

Travel from Barcelona to Pamplona by Renfe train or by bus. Trains leave from Barcelona Sants. Buses leave from Estacion de Autobuses Barcelona Nord and Barcelona Sants. ALSA (with transfer at Zaragosa) and ViBASA are major service providers on this route.

There is seasonal bus service from Pamplona bus station to SJPdP provided by Conda. Conda is owned by ALSA. See international schedule on ALSA website. Purchase ticket at Pamplona bus station.

2002 Madrid Airport

The airport in Madrid is called Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas Airport (MAD). There are 4 terminals. T1, T2, and T3 are in one building. Terminal 4S is connected to Terminal 4 by Automatic People Mover (APM). There is shuttle service between all terminals.

2003 Getting around in Madrid

Connections to Madrid include subway (Metro), light rail transit (Cercanias), and bus (EMT).

Madrid Metro has stations at T1-T2-T3 and at T4. The trains run every 6 - 12 minutes.

Madrid Cercanias has a station at T4. The trains run every 30 minutes.

EMT Madrid Aeropuerto Express operates a bright yellow express bus every 13 -20 minutes from the airport T1-T2-T3 and airport T4 to Puerta de Atocha Renfe station.

EMT Madrid #200 bus goes from airport T1-T2-T3 and airport T4 to Intercambiador de Avenida de America.

Irun/Hendaye

Irun is a Spanish city on the border with Hendaye France. Its an important location because there are only four places where there are railroad connections between Spain and France and this is one of them.

The railroad gauges and train voltage requirements used in Spain are different from those in France. A transfer is needed for any rail traffic that crosses the border.

Irun and Hendaye are transportation hubs for the Basque region.

Airport

The San Sebastian airport (EAS) is located in Hondarribia in sight of and in walking distance from Irun Renfe Station. (Take a bus or taxi anyway)

Trains

Renfe operates trains that terminate in either Irun or Hendaye. Trains terminating in Hendaye make a stop in Irun. Renfe may not pick up passengers in Hendaye. South bound, Renfe operates trains from Irun.

SNCF operates TGV and Intercites trains that terminate in Irun. SNCF may not pick up passengers in Irun. North bound, SNCF operates TGV, Intercites and TER trains from Hendaye. North and South bound trains make a stop in Bayonne where another TER train connects to Saint Jean Pied de Port.

Metro Donostialdea and Euskotren operates a commuter rail service that connects Bilbao, San Sebastian, Irun and terminates in Hendaye. The Metro Donostialdea is useful to bridge the gap between Irun Renfe Station and Gare d'Hendaye. Colon Metro station is located close to Renfe station. Exit Renfe station turn right and cross the bridge over the tracks to find Colon station entrance. Hendaia Metro station is co-located with Gare d'Hendaye.

Renfe operates a Cercanias light rail transit line from Brinkola to Irun via San Sebastian.

Comboios Portugal operates a trenhotel from Lisboa and Porto Portugal. The trenhotel terminates in Hendaye France.

This post describes travel options from Biarritz airport BIQ (France) to Pamplona.

Executive Summary

The Biarritz airport site indicates ALSA, through its subsidiary CONDA, provides service from Biarritz airport to Pamplona via San Sebastian several times daily. This is a new service and the schedule keeps changing (March 2015)

Otherwise, travel from Biarritz to Irun or San Sebastian/Donostia via Hendaye for more frequent service options. Probably the most viable options (depending on timings) are:

Take C bus to Gare Biarritz. Take SNCF train to Hendaye or Irun (TER terminates Hendaye TGV terminates Irun). Take Donostialdea Metro to San Sebastian. Take ALSA bus from San Sebastian to Pamplona.

Discussion

There is infrequent direct bus service from Biarritz to Pamplona.

There is frequent bus and train service from Biarritz to Hendaye and Irun.

There is train service and infrequent bus service from Irun to Pamplona.

There is infrequent bus service from Biarritz to San Sebastian.

There is frequent (pretty much hourly) bus service from San Sebastian to Pamplona.

Biarritz airport (BIQ) to Hendaye:

Take ATCRB #816 bus from Biarritz airport to Gare d'Hendaye; or,

Take Chronoplus bus line C to Gare Biarritz (6 minutes). From Biarritz take SNCF TGV train to Irun or SNCF TER train to Hendaye.

Hendaye to Irun

Take Donostialdea Metro commuter rail from Gare d'Hendaye to Irun Colon station. Exit Colon station, turn right, cross bridge over tracks, turn left to find Irun Renfe station.

Irun to Pamplona

La Burundesa provides bus service from Irun Renfe Station to Pamplona once daily. You can use ALSA site for schedule; or,

Renfe operates trains from Irun to Pamplona.

Pamplona bus station site indicates Vibasa provides bus service from Irun to Pamplona but the Vibasa website does not show service at time of writing.

Hendaye (or Irun) to San Sebastian

Take Donostialdea Metro commuter rail from Hendaye or Irun to San Sebastian (Amara station); or,

Take Renfe Cercanius from Irun to San Sebastian Renfe Estacion del Norte.

Biarritz Airport to San Sebastian

PESA provides bus service from Biarritz Airport to San Sebastian twice daily.

San Sebastian to Pamplona

Map San Sebastian - 41 is Renfe station 42 is Euskotren Amara station 43 is Bus station

http://www.sansebastianturismo.com/images/ssturismo/pdf/city-map-donostia-san-sebastian.pdf

The bus to Pamplona leaves from San Sebastian bus station. The bus station in San Sebastian is located outdoors at Plaza Pio XII beside Hotel Amara Plaza about 700 meters south from Amara station or across the river from the Renfe Station.

ALSA provides bus service from San Sebastian to Pamplona on almost hourly basis.

Some updates/corrections/extra info:

Renfe connects with SNCF at Irun/Hendaye and Port Bou/Cerbère where there is break of gauge.

...and at Lator de Querol-Enveig (Latour-de-Carol-Enveitg in French).

CP operates trains from Lisboa and Porto Portugal terminating in Madrid and in Hendaye France.

Out of Porto, the train isn't direct (you need to change trains in Coimbra-B).

1663 Bilbao to Bayonne Bus Option

There are PESA buses twice daily (except Sunday) from Bilbao Termibus to Place de Basques Bayonne.

Alsa has buses from Bilbao to Bayonne too. Take a look at the web of Alsa for info about schedules and fares. I don't know where within Bayonne stop the Alsa buses though.

SNCF TGV and Intercites trains travel from Irun Renfe Station to Gare de Bayonne.

French trains travel to Irún but not out of Irún. On the other hand, Spanish trains travel to Hendaye but not out of Hendaye. Therefore, to go from Irún to Bayonne by train, you need to change in Hendaye.

Barcelona is connected by Renfe to border crossings at Irun/Hendaye and Port Bou/Cerbère where there is break of gauge connections to the SNCF rail system in France.

...and to Lator de Querol-Enveig.

Renfe and SNCF have recently started rail service direct from Barcelona to Paris.

...and to Lyon, Marseille, Toulouse and some in-between stations.
